author: A_Brickset_user
review: I really loved the prospect of a re-release of this set. Great for a Castle collection since it is not too pricy, but a good size. As mentioned earlier, there is no whinch. Because it opens up, there can't be a baseplate. But I had truoble with the front left and right corners 'cause of that. If TLC had used three different baseplates, a large rectangle, and two half-the-size-of-that-squares, then it would be a bit stronger in the corners, and could still open up reasonably well. The re-release had no extra 1x2 bricks, which was definetly the most common piece, but one extra 1x1. (Or maybe I forgot to put that in.) This is the first set this year that actually offered me a challenge to build. This is a very good castle all the same, and is currently under siege by my Fright Knights and Bulls, with Majisto, the blue wizard with the long beard (representing the Falcons here) and Willa, the Fright Knights' witch, battling outside. There are four extra plumes, if you put two of them on the Knights. 424 pieces.

author: A_Brickset_user
review: Bravo! The Moravian castle is back! Old good classic castle. The last castle is very junorized! But this-roman castle and Moravian knights,old cavalry... Ok,but i will too haundet castle with princess and ghost. Good idea  fo re-relased,no? And price is too good 1499CZK.  This is 36 Dollars or Euro. I must at morning go and buy this living legend! Thank you LEGO!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: A really castle of norman ages ! Best choice - ideal set for any Kingdom fans !
review: I bought this set a one month ago. This is a probably one of best castles. The german styled half-timbered palace,normans towers - this are the main characters of this little castle or fortress. Yes, it is Sion - castle of last hussit´s leader Prokop Holy (Prokop the Bald)a little board castle. This set is ideal for intermediate builders,desing is very well,two knights with light armor,four foot soldiers with lances and bows. The walls are openable. You can´t find any juniorization - this is a real lego of old times. It is a really living legend,a last castle is only rumor of this norman fortress. And minifigs are smiling. But in my set i havent a two parts - unfortunatelly :(.  Yes, so with it makes ! Ten points

author: A_Brickset_user
title: One of the top 5 Lego castles for sure!
review: In the last years before I gave up Lego, this was probably my most desired set.  It's not a big castle, but it's rather sweet and excellent value.  It has a sizable number of figures for a set of it's size, some nice special roof parts, and many castle wall parts.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Cows with guns
review:
Amazing.
Everything in this set reeks of castley goodness. if they brought this set out as part of a new theme in the shops, It would have a cheap storyline tacked on to it. But now, YOU actually make the story. Not lego, YOU. if this set was in shops today, all the figs would have names...
Oh, the review!
PROS: 
For such a small castle, the number of figs is great.
Modular. Need I say more?
Tudor frame wall.
Nice assortment of bulk bricks and corners.
Limited colours(more realistic).
FOUR sides.
Simple, yet effective.
Good weapons.
CONS:
A bit bland.
Conclusion: This set is a parts pack in disguise.

P.S: On the second pic(the back of box, the alternative castle), There are THREE figs with red waists. The actual set has TWO.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: fortified cheateu
review: I have received this from ebay today. This is the best castle made to date with Black Monarch's Castle. It gives a safe place for your men, a keep that is succesfully fortified and the feeling that once the drawbridge is closed noone can enter this castle. Minifig selection of black falcons are always beatiful as well.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Fantastic Castle!
review: This is a phenominal castle set.  I wanted this set when I was younger, and with it's re-release, I was finally able to get one!  It's a surprisingly challenging set to build too -- there's no large baseplates (a slight drawback -- it's hard to build this set on a carpet surface -- you have to build it on a desk or table).  It's a really nice set though.  A whole slew of pieces make it easy to craft alternative models.  I really, really like this set.  Overall, if you are a fan of castle, especially classic castle, this is an essential purchase.  It was so splendid to have it re-released!  More re-releases like this, please!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: I bought 2
review: This was releared Chrisymas 2003 and I bought 2 - only 25euro's each! I also bought a huge, grey base plate. So this is what I did...... I built the 2 castles up, too awhile because it was different, with stone age build blue-print. When I built the two up, I opened up the sets( you could set the castle in 2 different positions)and put them back to back on the grey base plate. This left me with an entrance on both north and south ends of the castle. So I have 4 footmen, 4 archers and 4 knights. I added in loads of extras such as a throne(smack in the middle of the castle), a king, some barrels storing extra weapons, tables and cups so the men can drink beer, get locked and cause trouble. I'm not a wierdo, I promise. I may be 20 and all, but lego, once into it, is something that never goes away. I collect sets and store them away. Anyways, I was very lucky to get this set and if you come across it, tell me and I'll mind it for you. Yes, mind it. I dropped a mark because the castle isn't very high. The lego men can easily give each other a leg and a duck over the thing.... So that's all.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Man the ramparts!
review:
This is perhaps one of the oldest castles.  The oldest I think is that odd yellow castle.  You get some very nice knights with the back falcon emblem.  You get 2 archers, 2 guardsmen, and 2 horseback nights.  The helmets are very traditional, ixpecially the horsebackers and the archers ones.  The castle itself is hard to build from flimsy instructions. The castle is very easy to break and can be battered up and shattered easily.  The grey colour scheme is nice and the printed pieces are good too.  It is very open inside which leaves space to play but I wish it was on a baseplate rather than the flimsy stuff. It is cool that it can open up and make a good wall and the draw bridge is pretty neat. This is a nice set and if I am not misteaken, a lego legend! It is old and classic, and not that expensive, but for thus price, I would recommend the new Citadel of Orlan for the traps and special features.  A nice set, but a little flimsy indeed. 
A certain 7!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: I bought 5 of this set !
review:
This is really a terrific set. It has so many minifigs, horses, castle walls, corner walls, and slopes.......... Wonderful. 

At first, it was sold at USD35 (the normal/standard price)and I bought 2 of it. There was a Lego warehouse sale in Singapore. I bought another 3 at USD15.

I hope TLC will release some more classic castle and pirates sets. But don't make them exclusive at S@H. I hate the fact that S@H doesn't deliver to Malaysia or Singapore. Please don't make us (the Asia AFOL) suffer. Thanks.

Play on.

author: pfccypret
title: My first big lego set
review: I got this in the late 80s. It was my first "big" lego set. I sent an afternoon putting it together, then hours playing with it. You got a lot of cool parts, and quite a few mini-figs. It really is a great set.

author: Novelty
title: Another Legend!
review:
Out of the handful of sets released in 1986, two have been chosen to be featured in the Legends series.  And that's 2 out of the entire range of Castle sets in the 80s.  1986 was a good year for Castle.

This set though is interesting, thanks to the corner/45º bricks which have been used to an amazing effect to form the towers on either side of the drawbridge.  The obvious good thing about this set that makes it stand out from the rest is the balcony and house with steeple and the yellow wall near the back.  This forces the castle to "unlock" unsymmetrically which is a good thing.

However, there are a few things missing from the design - there's no porticullis for starters and the drawbridge is manually raised and lowered without the use of a winch.  Also there are only two knights in this set and a minimal amount of other soldiers.  In the looks department, the corner walls and the yellow wall gives the castle its character, but it also allows the designer to take short cuts in the design - there are no stairs or ladders in this castle.  And just below the balcony, there seems to be pillar holding up nothing which is odd.  This castle is definately not a replacement for the earlier one (6073) but it looks sleeker and less square-ish and the facade is more symmetrical.

author: toofpikk
title: great
review:
All I can say is its a great set, when I bought this I was speechless, not at the set, at the price! but then I remembered I had all these other knight sets, so I combined all of them to get a massive fortress! now, enough talk and more serious stuff!

5?!  I chose it to be 5 because it is a really fantastic set if you are imaginative. it comes as a fold out castle, 6 minifigures and lots and lots more!

One thing though ... if you don't already have any other major knights sets this isn't worth buying, for it doesn't have that many pieces, but as I said, if it's for a child then go buy it!

author: Ernst
title: Great by simplicity
review:
One of the smallest castle's but really one of the nicest. Especially the simplicity makes it a great castle to build.

 

Building these old castle's is big fun because all of the small bricks you have to use. Some wall parts and towers og course too but mainly small bricks; I love it !!

 

Like said before mostly small parts but what I love most of this set are the yellow parts and the black roof. Missing here is a mechanism to pull up or lower the drawbridge, but that's really the only minus of this set.

 

Playability is low for kids I think, the set has no opponents for the 5 Falcon Knights and lacks a jail. You have to add other sets to play with it. But I really don't care, I build it, admire it and love it.

 

Average price according to Bricklink is about € 60,00. I bought it for less (missing the center flag) so for me a good deal cause I think the average is a fair price for this lovely Castle.

author: SirSven7
title: Lego Steve's Review
review:
The second Falcon castle, this set is a lot more aesthetically pleasing than the first, The small yellow structure at the back (possibly a chapel) is a nice counter to the grey of the walls, the yellow flags on the front also help tie this image together. Unique to this set is the small blue flag with the Falcon’s symbol upon it, whilst the yellow timber frame was first seen here (and only used once after this).

The only criticism I would give to this set is the lack of shields, the previous castle was very generous but with this set less so. Overall that is a minor complaint and the set was so popular it was re-released in the Legends series in 2002, proving its high quality (on a minor note, in 1986 both this set and the Guarded Inn were build and then released as Legends sets, 1986 was a good year for castle).

If you like this review or if you wish to see images of alternate builds for this set and other sets for this faction click on the link to find it and all reviews of the Castle sets

http://legosteveblog.blogspot.com/2011/08/lego-black-falcon-sets-1984-1992.html

author: Pedro_Furlanetto
title: One of the most beautiful Castle sets ever
review:
The yellow wall (panel), the details in round 1x1 brick, the roof and the towers of front made this fortress one of the most beautiful sets released by Lego Group.

         For sure that's a legend from 1986, 3 years before I born. Talking about time, this set  only can be rivaled by 90's 6081 - King's Mountain Fortress in terms of "fortress" and in terms of castles just a few are comparable to 6074 - Black Flacon's Fortress.

          The parts and minifigures are ok. We have two brave knights with cape and only 2 black falcon's shields and swords it's a shame but, we have an axe, decored panels and grey walls too and 2 yellow arch o_O, maybe it can be gray, anyway... Well, you can construct some frames in the areas of fortress, the set accepts this and that's pretty nice!

            This set is unique and have the style of 80's Lego! 

 

 

Maybe you can listen Manowar to build this, maybe not! LOL 

 

Hail!

author: goldenbane
title: The original fortress of the mighty Black Falcons!
review: Lego re-released this set a few years ago, and I absolutely had to jump at the chance to finally own it!  I always thought Black Falcon's Fortress was one of the prettier early Lego castles, even though it was somewhat tiny compared to what the Crusaders and Black Knights would have.  It was the first set I ever got that had a real working drawbridge, and I thought that was really neat with how it worked!  An amazing castle, and a high recommendation to anyone who can get their hands on one!
